alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Somerset (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 13 at 2:25PM EDT until August 13 at 6:15PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of west central and western Maine, including the following counties, in west central Maine, Somerset. In western Maine, Franklin and Oxford. * WHEN...Until 530 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 224 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Eustis, Rangeley, Kingfield, Carrabassett Valley, Phillips, Dallas Plantation, Caratunk Plantation, Coplin Plantation, Redington and Wyman.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
